definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Somebody gonna do something about the gophers.
sentences.chinese: 总得有人想法子对付地鼠。

sentences.english: 'There's got to be a little gallows humor to get you through the day,' Mr. Obama said.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马说，总得有点儿黑色幽默让人们撑下去。

sentences.english: The chrysanthemum are all ready. They deserve to bloom once.
sentences.chinese: 菊花都绣好了，总得开一回。

sentences.english: Prince Henry They say, madam, it takes one to know one.
sentences.chinese: 亨利王子夫人，人们常说总得花时间去了解一个人。

sentences.english: The downside of fiscal stimulus is that someone must pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 财政刺激方案的唯一坏处就是总得有人买单。

sentences.english: A life, he will have to express some emotion.
sentences.chinese: 人生在世，总得发表一些感慨。

sentences.english: The thing about candles and being outside is that you always have to keep wind in mind.
sentences.chinese: 在室外使用蜡烛的时候，你总得留意风势。

sentences.english: You always have to revert back to the English.
There are twenty-four hours in each day, and I must spend them somehow.
sentences.chinese: 每天有二十四小时，总得很过去的。

sentences.english: The scores for all behaviours were then added to derive an overall lifestyle score.
sentences.chinese: 最后，将所有行为的得分相加，获得生活方式总得分。

sentences.english: Our team holds the record for total points scored.
sentences.chinese: 我们队保持着总得分的最高记录。

sentences.english: The larger issue is one of equality.
sentences.chinese: 总得平等的对待问题的双方。

sentences.english: Sometimes, you should control your temper.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，你总得控制自己的脾气。

sentences.english: In conclusion, what does this mean for our media business?
sentences.chinese: 总得来说，这对于媒体产业意味着什么？

sentences.english: A spider has to pick up a living somehow or other, and I happen to be a trapper.
sentences.chinese: 蜘蛛总得想办法活下去啊，碰巧我是一个结网捉虫的。

sentences.english: We gotta get everything set up and then we can come out in the open.
sentences.chinese: 咱们总得把一切都准备妥当了，才能公开出头露面。

definition: good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
at the minimum/at the very least
in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
